Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: We love: Good value, great zoom, macro feature ....We hate: Laggy playback of pics....Verdict:An excellent compact camera with great zooming skills The Nikon Coolpix S8000 lays claim to the title of the world's slimmest 10x zoom compact. And while tech is dominated by constant chatter about “world firsts”, this nifty little number is every bit as good as its makers reckon. Want to know why? Dive into our Nikon Coolpix S8000 camera review now and we'll reveal all. 27.3mm might seem a tad chunksome in this age of superslim gadgets, but factor in the Nikon Coolpix S8000's 10x optical zoom and NIKKOR lens and you'll soon realise it's a proper size zero snapper. The zoom is the real big drawer with the Nikon Coolpix S8000. Use it in conjunction with the ace macro mode and your shots will be imb ... ued with excellent detail and will let you get close up without any nasty blur around the edge of your pics. One grumble we do have the macro feature and zoom lens working together is the excessive noise around the corners of images. It's not a massive deal-breaker, but hardcore camera fanatics will definitely pick up on it. Push the lens wider though and your landscape shots will really look the part. The 30mm shots we took looked vast and rich in detail, perfect if you want cracking pics without investing in something bulkier and pricier. Read our Toshiba X100 camcorder review Elsewhere the Nikon Coolpix S8000 is instilled with the camera maker's excellent and easy-to-use UI. Accessing scene modes is straightforward via one button, letting you optimise your shots wherever you are. The LCD screen slapped on the back is ace too. At 3-inches it's more than ample for viewing your handiwork, although we would have preferred AMOLED in order to get a slightly bigger viewing angle. The real issue we had though was with reviewing images, with the Nikon Coolpix S8000 taking at least four seconds to process your shot before you can peep it round the back of the camera. It becomes increasingly infuriating if you're a snapper who's quick on your feet. That said, this is a small quibble with such a fully featured camera, especially one that costs around £250. If you're after a new compact, the Nikon Coolpix S8000 is certainly not a bad shout. expand » « collapse
Item.HelpfulCount: 2 out of 2 found this review helpful.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
The Nikon Coolpix S8000 is a compact camera that manages to do something others don't - pack a 10x zoom into a compact chassis.
At just 3cm thick, the S8000 is the thinnest 10x zoom compact camera on the planet.
The problem with long zooms in compact cameras is obvious - squeezing all that glass into a slim, pocketable body is extremely difficult, which is why most non-DSLRs with a 10x zoom or longer tend to be DSLR-style "bridge" cameras.
Read: 45 best digital cameras in the world today
Bridge cameras, while ideal for those looking to improve their photography without splashing out on a DSLR, are bulky, heavy and generally more expensive than their compact brethren.
Not the S8000. It comes packing a massive lens into a body less than 30mm thick. It's a t ... rue telephoto lens, as well. Converted to 35mm, it measures from wide-angle, at 30mm, to a length many sports photographers would be happy with, at 300mm.
There's plenty else that appeals too.
In its fastest mode, the S8000 has a claimed top speed of 3fps; significantly quicker than most compact cameras and a reasonable speed for basic wildlife or sports photography.
Alternatively, it's a powerful 720p video camera, recording 24fps footage for up to half an hour.
Consider the 3-inch, 920,000-pixel screen, all-metal construction and very high resolution (14.2 megapixels) and the S8000, on paper, could be one of the very best compact cameras money can buy.
The S8000 handles nicely. The bulge around the lens means there's plenty to hold on to, and zooming in and out doesn't change the camera's centre of gravity too much.
The all-metal construction feels fairly tough and accident-resistant, if not quite as bulletproof as the Canon G11. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
There's a lot to be said for simplicity, and the almost fully automated Nikon Coolpix S8000 compact camera is the ideal high-zoom option for anyone who doesn't want to fuss with in-camera settings.
More-advanced photographers and learn-as-you-go shooters won't like the lack of manual controls, but people looking for a dead-simple pocket megazoom will appreciate the Nikon Coolpix S8000 camera.
The 10X-optical-zoom Nikon Coolpix S8000 offers a wide-angle-to-telephoto reach of 30mm to 300mm, 720p high-definition video capture at 30 frames per second, and one of the sharpest 3-inch-diagonal LCDs we've seen on a point-and-shoot camera. This camera pretty much drives itself: shooting modes include full auto (which also lets you tweak white balance, metering options, autofocus mode ... , and ISO), 15 scene modes, and an automatic scene selector that chooses the right scene mode for the shooting environment.
Also in the mix are a Smart Portrait mode optimized for single or group portraits - it lets you tweak skin-softening filters, a smile-triggered shutter, and a blink detector - as well as a motion-tracking mode that locks in on a moving object and keeps it in focus. That's it for the shooting modes; you don't get any manual aperture or shutter controls. The automation tends to do a very good job, though.
In our imaging tests, the Nikon Coolpix S8000 led our latest pocket megazoom test group in lack of distortion, and it was among the leaders for exposure quality and sharpness. Colour accuracy and video quality were only mediocre, however, and as a result the Coolpix S8000 posted an overall imaging score of Good.
Here are sample clips that we shot in bright indoor lighting and in low light with the Nikon Coolpix S8000. For the highest-quality clips, select 720p from the drop-down menu in the lower-right corner of each player.
Battery life is on the low side. The Nikon Coolpix S8000 has a CIPA battery life rating of 210 shots per charge of its lithium ion battery, well short of the 300-plus-shot performance of your average point-and-shoot camera.
In our hands-on tests, the Nikon Coolpix S8000 had the best macro mode of any of the cameras in our latest roundup. We were just about able to touch the lens to a subject and still get a crisp, well-focused photo without the autofocus searching in and out.
You can correct exposure problems easily within the camera itself thanks to Nikon's D-Lighting feature, which you employ during image playback. Rather than attempting to correct backlit or underexposed images while you're capturing them, you reprocess images with D-Lighting after you shoot, creating a modified copy of your photo while retaining the original shot.
The Nikon Coolpix S8000 captures decent video, but audio pickup is weak from its top-mounted stereo microphones. What's more, you're limited to digital zoom while filming rather than being able to use the full power of its 10X-optical-zoom lens.
This is a slim and lightweight camera, due to the lack of a protruding hand grip. It's a bit boxy, and despite its lack of bulk, you'll need both hands to secure it for shooting. Unfortunately, the doors that cover the HDMI port and the USB connector on the camera are also lightweight, made of rubbery plastic and prime candidates to tear off after about a dozen uses.
NEXT: our expert verdict >>

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Pros:Very good image quality Well designed Easy to use ... Cons:Basic controls Brief menus Average stereo separation

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Small but powerful
Cons: Lens shutter fell down, it's in the shop
To be honest, ours is in the shop as I write the review. The lens shutter dropped down in front of the lens so we can't take pictures or video. We didn't purchase the warranty but it's still under a 1 year parts/labor from Nikon. We took the camera on vacation to disney and the thing was amazing. Beautiful pictures, great video in daylight..really poor video at night which is kind of expected. Be sure and read about the video zoom and focus before using it...we didn't and couldn't tell by the lcd screen that some video was being shot out of focus. Basically, you can't really zoom in while you're in video mode but if you zoom in and then begin video, it's in focus. The flash,like everyone else says is in a ... n odd place but we quickly got used to it and moved our fingers. We had fun using it at night for still pictures with the flash off. Took some amazing shots of the Magic Kingdom castle. But use a tripod or set it on something to do it. We didn't have any issues with batteries, they lasted all day. When it's working, it's a great camera and we love it! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Nikon S8000 Black Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Good Points: Great facilities, very large high quality screen.
Auto-focus in movie mode (not available on my much more expensive Nikon digital SLR camera!)
Extremely good quality on pictures and movies. The "bad points" noted below are not really serious shortcomings, just observations.
A great camera, as I would expect from Nikon. Bad Points: Disappointed to find optical zoom is fixed when in movie shooting mode (digital zoom only available).
When switched off, the lens protection shutters look a bit flimsy. The cover of the USB socket looks a bit flimsy too for something that has to be opened and shut quite often.
On a compact camera, a bit surprised to find a pop-up flash, which you have to manually close. Not really a problem, but it looks bit physica ... lly vulnerable when it's raised.
The help function for the menus is pretty basic and doesn't tell you anything you don't already know! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Short Lag Time; Great Zoom; Nice Body Color; Good Image Stabilization
It is a very good camera. The features are excellent. Good battery life, Crystal clear Image quality, fantastic zoom. Kind of camera for scenery shooting. Little bit on high price, rest all cheers!!! :-)

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I chose this camera because it reviewed very well in well-known published independent reviews. Having had a few weeks to use it, I can say that it is a sturdy and robust pocket-sized compact camera. The 14.2 megapixels give sharp photos. It is OK for movies too and can stream using an HDMI port. The controls are easy to use for any amateur and the screen gives clear images and on-screen-menu features. The rechargable battery lasts much longer than most AA battery cameras (although I would suggest a second battery & external charger if using a memory card larger than 4Gb. If this camera has any negative points, it would be a slightly less robust pop-up flash and a lack of a manual viewfinder. For a pocket sized camera that can be used almost anywhere, this is a great buy. Professional p ... hotographers would still benefit from paying more to get a decent digital SLR, but for most people, this is more than adequate. Well done Nikon, you finally pulled me away from your competitors! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I got this camera 15 days back. The features are really nice. I got a refurbished one, so I was worried if I would have all the features perfect in it. I explored all the features and it worked perfectly fine. Based on other reviews of what people have said, you cant zoom in while shooting vidoes thats correct. But the trick is in you can zoom in with photo shooting mode first and then press the video recording button. Obviously you cant change the optical zoom then. You still can use the 4x digital zoom. The flash position is slightly awkward but you get used it in a day or two. The macro option is amazing it worked well. Its not that good for low light in night. You have to take it from nearby. As has been said in some of the reviews the photo appears as a painting in night in somecases. ... You have to work around with it a bit. Battery life is good, no problem at all. It has very good sports contious options. The smile detection also is awesome. But all in all a great value for money. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I bought the COOLPIX S8000 because I needed an easy point and shoot camera to carry with me when I hike and paddle in SE Alaska. I never want to miss out on the photo opportunities I come across almost daily, but because it rains most of the time in SE Alaska, the S8000 is just so much faster and easier without compromising the vivid picture quality like I get with my D-90. Best of all, it is easy to use and also has some great features. Bought an extra battery for extended off the grid trips. The flash pops up on the upper left side of camera, which some folks may not like, but you get accustomed to it. I also like the fact that you can take a few photos without a memory card. I forgot to put my card in and took some great shots before I realized this. The pictures could be downloaded ea ... sily from camera to computer - no problem. I just bought one for my Dad for Christmas. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I purchased the S8000 as a refurbished unit and use it for general photography with an emphasis on close up images of flowers and still live images as well as some pet photography. I have given the camera more attention because of the limited Likes: 1. Focus range is nice 2. Controls are fairly straight forward 3. LCD screen is bright, clear, easy to use in most lighting situations 4. Image quality is very good 5. Both a Quick Start and more complete manuals are provided Concerns 1. The battery must be charged by plugging the camera into the charger. Therefore, the camera is not available during recharging. Nikon should have provided a separate battery charger that would make battery charging easier. 2. The camera's connection is protected by a flimsy cover. It is difficult to open ... and is easily bent. Then it is difficult to close and the cover does not lay flat against the camera body when closed. Nikon should have provided a better quality cover for that port. 3. I am concerned about the limited 30-day warranty that I believe should be one year to show Nikon's faith in their refurbished products. Conclusion I would recommend this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Pros: Good Image Stabilization, Large Clear LCD, Small / Compact ... Cons: Poor Image Quality I had a bad experience with the Coolpix S8000. It appears that a lot of the pictures are out of focus especially any that I have used the zoom feature. On the camera display they look fine, but after transferring them to my computer, using iPhoto to many of them are out of focus, very fuzzy. Also I ended up with "red eye" on some of the flash photos that I took of my great grandson. I was very unhappy with this camera especially after the high marks ir received from Consumer Reports. I returned it today and am in the market for another digital camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I'm an advanced basic user, but will probably use this camera just for snapshots. It's quick to start up, little shutter lag, quick to save the image, and quick to recharge the flash. The lens is good quality, good focus from edge to edge. Menu controls are pretty straightforward, and having the on-line help built into the camera display itself is nice. Good LCD screen on the back, works pretty well in direct sunlight. I haven't used all the features yet, I still need to record some HD video and playback on the TV. -- The battery cover pops open easily, so be careful pulling the camera out of the case or out of your pocket so it doesn't snag on something. The USB connector for recharging the battery and for transferring pictures is behind a flimsy access door. No optical viewfinde ... r. Fewer cameras have those, but I kind of like it when following fast moving subjects. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to setup and use. Large LCD screen
Item.Review:
Pros: Fairly small and lightweight with big LCD screen.
Cons: Pop-up flash device is where one usually holds the camera.
The large LCD screen makes the S-8000 easy to see in almost any light. Video recording is a snap to start and stop with one button and the quality of videos is high. This camera used on "Auto" mode makes the best pictures regardless of lighting.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Easy to use & takes stellar pictures!
Item.Review:
Pros: Good in Low Light; Great Zoom; Short Lag Time; Good Image Stabilization; Nice Body Color
I decided to purchase the Nikon Coolpix s8000 after reading several mixed reviews. So far I have taken 550 pictures with it and they are stellar. Of course there are the occasional pictures that may be out of focus, but you will find that learning any new camera. Personally, I was looking for a point and shoot with great zoom capability that takes stellar stills, is compact, and worked well in low light conditions. These were all important because more often then not I'm on the motorcycle for shows and need something I can carry in my pocket and taking pictures well into the evening as well as indoors. The camera has also been great for capturing moments with the kids who aren't alway ... s the easiest to photograph. There can be slight lag between snapping shots with flash if you are trying to capture a lot of consecutive shots, but nothing noticeable to the point of getting upset about or being a deal breaker. I upgraded from older point and shoot cameras (5 megapixel Casio & Panasonic 7.2 megapixel). This is definitely an upgrade in all aspects. Great Nikon lens! Great zoom! Great pictures! Great LCD! Good battery life! I have also seen a lot of reviews complaining about video which I didn't care about to begin with because I have a HD digital camcorder for that, but I have taken some 15 second videos for fun and they came out nice. Video quality and sound were good on both my Mac and flat panel LCD using a HDMI cable for play back. I hope this review helps. Decided to write it because I saw so many mixed reviews out there and wanted to share my positive experience with this product. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
This little Nikon is a superb little camera.
Lots of nice feautures like subject tracking, and even take a photo when it detects a smile.
We took it to Disneyland and used it on full quality with an 8gig memory card which gave us over 1000 pictures to use.
The photos were stunning quality on screen (HD TV) and also in print.
Although if you want to view the pictures and videos in their true quality, the supplied cable is useless for this, you need a HD cable.
In my case I copied everything to my external hard drive (as I always do anyway) and streamed them via my PS3 to my HD TV.
We also used it to film a few things seeing as it had HD quality video, and it didn't dissapoint here either. 720p video was brilliant.
Highly recommended

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Woderful little camera. Lots of options.
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom; Nice Body Color
I would use this as a "casual" party camera and not for professional photographs. Settings are automatic and f stop and shutter speeds are not made, although they are shown on the viewfinder before the picture is taken. There are a lot of options that are adjustable though that I had not expected like ISO, pixel count and video.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I spent a long time scouring the internet looking at different cameras and what they had to offer. Following advice from a friend in the know I narrowed my search to Cannon and Nikon and eventually went for this one, which i can honestly say is worth every penny ( I got it on offer!) A great looking camera, easy to use, easy to understand instructions and great pictures and video. 2 small niggles I have is that the flash pops up when in use and its easy to forget and put your finger over it! Secondly the charger cover is a little bit flimsy! But overall a great camera for the money.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Nikon S8000 Black Digital Camera
Item.Review:
Good Points: Size. Bad Points: Pop up flash is terribly positioned so expect your left index finger to keep jumping when it springs up.
Image quality is very average considering the megapixels and lens. No battery meter??? If there is one, myself and the shop assistant couldn't find it.
Had trouble focussing at longer zoom ranges.
Zoom juts out in 2 jerky steps, not smooth at all. Surprised this made it passed quality control and for that price, it was a very disappointing purchase. Ended up swapping for the Panasonic TZ7 which was the same price.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The Zoom lense, Picture and Video quality
Cons: Pop-up Flash, battery cover and video button, Video is a .MOV file
Over the years I've owned about six or seven digital cameras and they've all been made by Sony. I had very good results with all my Sony cameras till I bought the new DSC-W370, the video was poor and the audio was terrible. I returned it to Best Buy and exchanged it for another one thinking that maybe I just got a bad camera because in the past I've had very good video/audio with my Sony cameras. However, the new one was still terrible so I decided to try the Nikon S8000. I was blown away by the picture and video quality, and the zoom on this camera is awesome. Maybe I'm just used to the Sony cameras but I do not like the controls on the Nikon. I have pr ... essed the video record button a few time by mistake, I do not like the location of it. The battery door on the bottom of the camera has popped open a few times, I hope I don't break it. I also don’t like the zoom control, it’s hard to do with just one hand on the camera. I think everyone already knows the flash is a pain but it does work well. My biggest complaint about the camera is that the video is a .MOV file, I would prefer a Mpeg file. A lot of video editing software don’t support .MOV files. I use Pinnacle Studio and it did not recognize a .Mov file. I know you can convert it but that takes extra time and hard drive space. I did end up buying a battery charger and an extra battery online for about $15, great deal. I did spend a little more than I would've on a Sony but I'm glad I got the Nikon. Having said all that, I do love the quality of the pictures and video, it’s amazing! I've attached a few skiing pictures for you to see.In a few months I'll hopefully get used to the controls and it shouldn't be an issue. I would love to combine the quality of the Nikon and the controls of the Sony, that would be a great camera. I typically only own a camera for about a year so it’ll be interesting to see what I buy next year? expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Size, resolution, weight, user interface, picture quality, zoom, screen size
Cons: battery life
Bought this to take backpacking as a compact alternative to my SLR. The large screen is great for sharing pictures with others during the trip. The scene presets are simple to use and make it easy to get good pictures without thinking about the camera setup. Took it snow camping and it was easy to use even with gloves on. There are separate buttons for still and video pictures, so you don't need to switch between modes.
The battery life isn't really a negative, just a suggestion to bring a spare. Showing videos on the camera is a great feature and a lot of fun but does use up the battery.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Good Image Quality; Short Lag Time; Large Clear LCD
This camera is small and easily carried in the pocket. It substitutes for my D-200 which sometimes is inconvenient to carry because of its weight and bulk. The photos are excellent with great macro capability and huge zoom. The flash is excellent although you have to hold the camera somewhat awkwardly in order not to interfere with the popup mechanism. HD video is a major plus for some users.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Nicest Nikon point and shoot yet
Item.Review:
Pros: VR (image stabilization),clean and low noise (fuzz) pics, navigation, screen, first shot delay, compact 10x
Cons: focus tracking in movie mode, high-pitch audio in movie mode.
Blows away past nikons, like s230, s330, s570, L100, even the new L110 in image quality. I love nikon slr, and they finally did a good job on a point and shoot, so i bought one, and am keeping it.
Pictures: Strong VR reduces handshake nicely. First shot delay is minimal and has accurate focus and metering. The AF illuminator allows focus in very low light. Macro mode would probably satisfy needs of CSI agent as i can see fibers on the paper i captured. However, have to switch to macro, it doesnt macro automatically. You can set a low ISO and step +2EV on a tripod for twilight scenes (max 8 ... sec exposure) but remember to shut VR off. The Smart Portrait Mode works and will snap ur subject as soon as they look and smile. Continuous is good with the 15mb/s card. Sport Continuous not so hot, but that is typical of ALL point and shoots.
Video: One touch record button to start capturing high def video, but focus tracking could be better, and the audio had that high pitch as if your ears are ringing, but the zoom and focus motor was hardly audible in the video. It looked nice on a 720p tv though.
Package: The camera is very compact for a 10x, smallest on market i think. Outer edge is softer grippy rubber, fairly ergonomic for a style built point n shoot, sometimes the flast is near left index but u get used to it. Screen is a brillieant high res 3".
Features: You can adjust vividness (saturation), and hue before shots. There are a variety of edits in camera after: d-lighting, downsampling, etc. Would be nice if it had manual controls in the menu like the Sony H20. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I won t be considering the other brands of digital cameras I had used in the past when if it comes time to replace this Nikon CoolPix S8000. Some digital cameras are great at Macro (close-up) photography but may lack clarity when taking a Landscape shot ( visa-versa). This one does all types of photography well! I regret not getting this camera sooner! The clarity of the pictures - even on the lower settings, is incomparable. Regarding the ease of use - well I referred to the manual a few times at first but for the most part the settings are intuitive. Interfacing it with a PC is a snap as is sharing pictures movies with others. Sports shots - those involving your subject s fast movements - come out GREAT! The movies look better too due to the anti-vibration lense and software. Now they ar ... e much easier to watch. I m not an expert photographer but the Nikon CoolPix S8000 lets me take pictures like one! I m completely happy with my purchase. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color; Great Zoom; Good Image Stabilization; Large Clear LCD; Small / Compact
Cons: Poor Flash; Poor Image Quality
The flash frequently does not fire, even when set manually to always fire. It may take ten shots to get a correct exposure for a particular scene. Even when the flash does fire (which could be 2-4 of the 10), 9 of those shots may be extremely under or over exposed. The exposure problems may also occur in non-flash shots. Other times the camera may work fine. Video mode button is located in a place which makes it easy to accidentally activate.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Pros: Easy To Use, Large Clear LCD, Quick start-up time, Short Lag Time ... Cons: Flash is located poorly, No Viewfinder This is a great camera. I love using it for my birdwatching and some small scenery photos. It takes great family and indoor photos as well. I find that the camera powers on VERY quickly so i can get an photo almost immediately. The two complaints I have with the camera are (1) The flash is in a terrible location. It pops up when you go to take a picture, but the natural "grip" i take on the camera is right over where the flash rests. (2) The lack of a view finder can be problematic at times as the LCD screen can be difficult to see in very bright situations. Overall this is a great camera, and I love it.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Review: Nikon S8000 Black Digital Camera
Item.Review: Good Points: Excellent little camera. Ideal for stowing in your back pack when out and about. Easy to use, great snaps and great value. Bad Points: Bad point is only a small gripe. Flash pop up is in an awkward spot when taking a pic but you soon learn how to hold this camera to combat the problem. Also battery life isn't as good as some cameras.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Pros: Easy To Use, Fast/accurate auto-focus, Good Image Quality, Good Image Stabilization, Good in Low Light, Great Zoom, Large Clear LCD, Nice Body Color, Short Lag Time, Small / Compact ... Cons: No Viewfinder GREAT OVERALL CAMERA. I BOUGHT IT TO COMPLEMENT MY DSLR, I BOUGHT NIKON D7000 ABOUT A MONTH AGO. I HAD PANASONIC DMC-TZ5 WHICH WAS A GREAT CAMERA BUT SHOT TO SHOT TIME WAS LONG AND ALSO THE PIC QUALITY WAS NOT GREAT IN LOW LIGHT. NIKON'S NEW CMOS SENSOR PROVES THAT POINT AND SHOOT CAMERAS CAN ALSO TAKE GREAT PICTURES IN LOW LIGHT. I LOVE THE 3 INCH 920 K DOT LCD WHICH IS SIMILAR TO MY DSLR, VIDEO QUALITY IS ALSO AWESOME. I DON'T REALLY CARE FOR MANUAL CONTROLS IN A POINT AND SHOOT CAMERA SINCE I CAN USE MY DSLR IF NEEDED. GREAT CAMERA FOR TRAVEL/OCCASIONS WHEN I DON'T WANT TO CARRY ... MY HEAVY DSLR BUT AT THE SAME TIME DON'T WANT TO COMPROMISE THE PIC QUALITY. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: Great camera for ease of use, speed, quality of photos (with auto setting...we're not professional photographers), automatic settings. Very happy with it for the price, just would have liked a touch screen instead of buttons/dial, but livable.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: An "ALL AROUND" Great smaller sized camera!
Item.Review:
Pros: The memories are in great quality!
Cons: location of flash, when the flash is in use....
I see why Consumer Reports rated this the top camera in its review of "compacts". This camera takes really nice pictures in all lighting types I've used it. I really like to do the settings manually, based on the light source I'm currently in.... then I point, focus and shoot all in one motion! Low light with no flash, low light with flash, distant subject, close subject, indoors, outdoors, flourescent light, incandescent light, sunlight... etc..... all came out full of vivid colors, and overall crisp-clear-clean pictures! Some shots have even entered into DSL quality. (Although I'm no professional photographer) The more I use it, the more I add to my positive review of it! I ... still need to try outdoors-evening close and far... but based on what I've seen... I bet it will be "good" at the least... expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very nice point and shoot camera
Item.Review: I got this camera just 4 days before a cruise in the Greek Isles so did not have alot of time to learn the camera. I read the quick start guide and did some little tests at home and then started to read the manual on the flight to Europe. After just a few uses and 1-2 hours of use it was easy and intuitive to use. I could change parameters and settings with ease . After a couple of days I felt comfortable shooting movies and trying some more exotic settings to be a bit more artsy with exposures and focus points. I took over 1500 pictures during the trip and about 20-25 minuites of video. All on less that 2 4 GB cards. the pictures on the computer screen look great. the battery lasted about a day of shooting, so every night I would swap out the battery and charge the other for the next ... day and carry it asa backup. My wife also has a Nikon that uses the same battry and we each had a camera and a total of 3 batteries.. This worked out great as we never missed a shot because of lack of a battery. The pop up flash is easily blocked by holding the camera. got used to that in just a couple of days. I am glad I got this camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a great camera. The epitome of point and shoot, which is probalby what most are looking for. I never shott outside of auto mode. In my admittedly amateur opinion, the picture quality is very good, as is the video quality. Battery life has not been an issue.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: picture quality and zoom
Cons: charging the battery in the camera
Picture is great and zoom feature is fantastic. I love all of the scene settings and the stability feature and the large screen size. The only small down side is you have to charge the battery in the camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Camera is much less than I would expect
Item.Review:
Pros: Nice Body Color
Cons: Movies do not play on Win; Poor Image Quality; Poor Image Stabilization
I bought an S3000 and an S8000. Neither of them take great pictures and the movies do not play on my Windows computers. I called customer support 4 times already and they do not help me. They asked me to send in some examples of pictures and movies. I sent them and then did not hear back from them. I called again after a week and they told me it would take 7-10 days to get a response. This is not a good way to keep a customer. I am very disappointed in Nikon.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Perfect Point & Shoot Size w/ the Best Features
Item.Review:
Pros: 10x Zoom, Size, Features (D-Lighting, HD Movie), It's a Nikon
Cons: I'll let you know when I find something not so great
I have always been a Nikon owner, but have used many other brand of cameras. The features on their point & shoots are very user friendly. My 1st Nikon was a Coolpix 3100 (3.1mp) lol, then a S7c (7.1mp), onto the D90 (12mp) now this handy little S8000. The S7c is still working perfectly but I wanted the HD Movie feature in a point & shoot. My D90 has that function, but I don't always want to lug around that DLSR. The quality of video & pix are superb! The D-Lighting feature is very helpful especially in backlit situations. The other reason I chose this camera is for the 10x Optical Zoom. There are many other cameras that have this, but none ... as compact. It's not the smallest point & shoot, but I prefer the size to be big enough to know that you have a camera in your hands. I hate the ones where your using your thumb & forefinger of each hand to hold it because it's soooo small. Overall it's a great camera with outstanding features & fuctionallity. I have yet to own a Nikon that disappoints me! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Not what I hoped it would be
Item.Review:
Pros: Great Zoom
Cons: Poor Image Quality; Poor Image Stabilization; Panorama gives bad result; Video is very jumpy
I was excited to get a camera that could take high def video and pictures. I am greatly disappointed with this camera. The panorama setting for this camera does not always work correctly. The video is smooth as long as you do not move. Once you start to pan the video is very jumpy on playback. If you watch it on the camera it seems OK, once you load it to the computer, it is bad. I recently went on vacation and took over 3000 pictures and about 1/3 of them came out blurry and a little out of focus. I would expect more from Nikon and a camera with these specs.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Good camera but compare others before you buy
Item.Review:
Pros: its small, has some neat features, has ability to take high quality photos, has a nice optical zoom, and you can plug in
Cons: is not ready as quickly on power up or after taking a pic, menu's a bit hard to access
We replaced an old Kodak easyshare with this camera, mainly because the Kodak was not taking good pictures in low/bright lighting and it was slow. I did a lot of research looking at shutter speed, aperture etc. to find the best one in our price range and decided upon this one. It is definitely an upgrade from our dinosaur but I'm still not convinced it's the best we could've gotten for the price. Probably if we were to mess around with the settings more and read up on everything, we might have better results however, we're more basic in that we want the camera ... to do most of the work (point and shoot). So if you're looking at a point and shoot but would like to have more manual power - then you might be very happy with this camera. Also the smile and blink function is pretty neat.
Overall, we're glad we have a better camera but as soon as we can justify spending another chunk of moolah on another in a year or so we'll be buying again. expand » « collapse

The only bad thing I have to say I don't like is where the flash is, it pops up in the left corner where you w ... ould usually put your pointer finger to take the picture. Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Excellent image quality and zoom for the compact size.
Cons: It's pricey for a point and shoot, but I don't mind paying for quality.
I felt the need to update my 3 year old point and shoot Sony camera and searched online for reviews. I have only owned Sony cameras in the past and decided to give a Nikon a try. I searched online reviews and decided on the S8000 model due to the 14.2 megapixel and sleek design. I love how the camera feels in my hands, it is very solid with a metal outter case. It is very compact and travels easily. So far I've taken about 200 pictures and I am blown away at the picture quality with using just the auto settings in the camera since I'm very much an amateur. Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)

Explore the camera: Auto Mode - Fast focus indoor with reasonable image quality (of course you must have good hand holding) Zoom & VR: work fine for me but somewhat noisy Scene mode: don't use auto scene detection. The camera get confuse when you aimed at different target Movie: You can only digital zoom. Camera Start-up: Fast but aggressive & a bit noisy. You can feel the movement of the lens when they start to get out. Camera temperature: getting warm after 15min of use (not because i'm holding the camera You will not need to tak ... e battery out to charge. However, the extension cord (to me) isn't long enough to wall charge. Charging the battery through computer USB port is good and convenient. Question: Why they don't use the conventional mini-usb? The product itself is 4 star I took 1 star off because the front lens door has scratch and the front of the camera (area around the lens) has several imperfection. (I will put some more information after the trip) expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: takes great pictures. stabilizes movement really well.
Cons: price tag for a digital camera is a little high, but it's worth it.
Overall, it's a great camera. I've used the software that came with the camera and enjoy editing photos. the panoramic feature is cool and easy to create. I love the size of the camera and the quality of pictures it makes.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: The optics on this camera are outstanding for a pocket camera
Cons: The flash is a pop-up that is located right where most folks put a finger to hold the camera.
I had to replace my Nikon S610 pocket camera because of an accident and the S8000 had just become available; how lucky for me. The camera features are similar to my S610 so the learning curve was small but the performance of the camera is exponentially better. The 10x optical zoom is terrific; it provides a 35mm format equivalent of 30mm thru 300mm, which allows some pretty impressive pictures of distant subjects. The 2x digital zoom does introduce some noise into the mix but even so, on well lit subjects, a 35mm equivalent of 600mm in a pocket camera is quite an accomplishment. At these long focal lengths, you ... do have to live with a f5.6 aperture, but even so, that is acceptable and pretty common for small format cameras. The ability to shoot HD video on this camera is a plus, but more to the point, unlike other cameras this is a one button push operation. No changing settings. no dealing with changing the basic camera setup (for still photos), just push the record button and it starts recording, push it again and it stops recording then returns to the still photo setup previously set.
The cons from my perspective are few but noticeable. The first one that stands out in my mind is the location of the pop-up flash. Located on the top left of the camera body, it is positioned just where most folks will want to put their left index finger when holding the camera this will necessitate changing the way you hold the camera if you are one of those. Another is that the camera lens, when cranked out to max zoom is pretty long, it stands about 2 inches beyond the camera body and although it is not excessive it does seem pretty long when compared to the size of the camera. The final thing is the autofocus, although accurate, does seem to be a bit slow to me, but that may be that I am just used to my DSLR (also a Nikon) which is almost instant.
All in all, this is an impressive camera overall, and especially for a pocket sized camera. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Very good pocket camara with video
Item.Review: I have a D300s for my normal photography. I bought this for back up, and for convenient photos. S8000 has the great zoom, and image stabilization. The size is very small to fit the shirt pocket. it is quiet when you take a photo or video. So people around would not notice you. The video of 720p taking is also very easy. 29 mins video is good enough for most situations. The image is acceptable but not as good as a DSLR, the start up time is about 1 second, which is also acceptable. The fast photo of 11fps and 3fps is only for small size images, which is not very attractive for me. I would rather use 720p video for motion taking. The LCD display is very good, so you can clearly see if you take a bad photo with the amplify zoom. I use a 16G SDHC card and works fine. It shows 2000+ for 14M ... * photo sand 3000 for 14M photos. Good enough for several days travel. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: I was expecting more, given the hype and the wait. The lag is better than most pocket cameras i have, but not great. i am spoiled by nikon's dslrs, though. maybe there is not one to come close. The flash, i feel, is poor design. with it popping up when called upon, it presents a problem if you happen to have your hand where it sits, which is where you would normally be holding it. if your fingers are on the left side and a flash is needed, it simply does not exert enough pressure to give you the hint it needs to come up. It will pop up after you release your hold, then becoming vulnerable to damage. also, you can easily press or inadvertently twirl the rotary dial when you did not mean to change a setting. the idea is clever, but as a low light camera, it is possible to change setting ... s you did not mean to change. might be good if there was a button lock on the rotary. photo quality is good. phot expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Pictures seemed good indoors, nice zoom, excellent macro lens built in, 3" LCD
Cons: Cheezy lens cover sticks, pop up flash, a bit thick, streaks in some movies
I bought this camera for indoor shots, zoom lens, 10x, macro lens, .4 in, 3"CD and image quality. It did all these things quite well, however I had to return it for some issues I hope Nikon addresses. First, the lens cover louver shutters stick. I had some images with partial shutters stuck! The Cool pix S70 seems more robust. I would prefer that slide cover instead. Second, I got Blue streaks on some movies? some issue with the video driver perhaps. Yes, I also think the flash seems to be in the way. The camera seemed to be poor for shooting motion shots indoors. That may have been a setting. Lastly it just fel ... t a bit bulky compared to the Kodak. I will probably wait and see if mine was a fluke and try another. Based on other point and shoots, this one seems like my best bet to avoid lugging the SLR around. I will recommend it but keep my problems as caution, beware. expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)

The image quality using the macro and zoom is good, even when using the digital zoom. The 3" LCD is nice. There is little to no time lag between when the shutter release button is pressed to actual photo taken. I would like to have had a seperate battery charger than the in camera charger but I can live with it. Bottom line - It's not as big as I expected which is good, great zoom and I love it.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: ease of use; great design
I wanted a camera that was a step above the basic point and shoot but that would still be portable and easy to use. I am very pleased with the Coolpix S8000 so far. It has a 10x zoom, which allows me to capture sports and my kids on the playground without them knowing I am taking the picture. The LCD screen is large and very clear. The feature that I use the most is probably the sports continuous mode. This is great, you just hold the button down and it takes picture after picture. This works great for taking pictures of toddlers or anyone else that doesn't like to cooperate! The quality of the pictures has been good - I am by no means an expert, but everything looks very lifelike and never washed out.
My one complaint is that the flash ... is in sort of an awkward place - right where you would hold the camera. I am ok with this as I have adapted, but when others use my camera they always end up pushing the flash down by accident.
All in all, a great purchase! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This camera takes gorgeous pictures for a small compact point and shoot. It is light and compact, easy to put in your pocket. It takes gorgeous outdoor pictures and I was really impressed with the indoor low light photos...as long as you were in decent distance of the flash. The only bad thing about this camera and the only reason I did not give it 4 stars is because of the placement of the flash. The flash is located at the top left, right where you would naturally hold the camera...so when the flash pops up, it is blocked by your finger. They say the placement of the flash helps to reduce red eye, which it really does, but you have to learn to pop the flash before holding it for the photo and especially before handing it over to someone else to take a picture for you. Other than that, a ... great buy for the price! expand » « collapse

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review:
Pros: Wonderful zoom, in a tiny body.
Cons: Everything else is not as good as Canon or even Lumix cameras I've owned in the past.
I bought this camera for it's zoom to size ratio. I also figured that I couldn't go wrong with a name like NIKON. The zoom is great, picture quality is good, even at great distances.
However - it's non-obvious what shooting mode the camera is in at any given time. The smart scene selection often decides to switch to a strange mode just as you are ready to take a time sensitive shot. There is a panoramic assist function that works (once you get it to the included software on your PC), but if you've ever seen what a Canon can do, you'll be disappointed with this.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.Review: This is a great point and shoot. The photo quality is excellent. The controls are very intuitive. The LCD is very bright and can be easily seen in daylight. Great camera to have in your pocket and whip it out for a great shot!

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
Item.ReviewTitle: Rockin' Image Quality in a Compact
Item.Review: Pros: Good Image Stabilization, Great Zoom, Short Lag Time ... Cons: Poor Flash Great lens with plenty of zoom capability and excellent picture quality. Having used it for sporting events, wildlife photography and candids, it provides crystal clear, sharp, well-focused photos with vivid and accurate colors. On the down side, I haven't been as successful in low lighting (an SLR would be better) or very close shots (better left to my Casio Exilim with macro mode). The pop-up flash is intentionally away from the lens to help reduce red eye, however my left hand typically gets in its way. This excellent compact camera fulfills 95% of what I'd use an SLR for...and I've got it with me 100% of the time for many of those shots I just wouldn't get with a larger camera.

Item.Item: Nikon Coolpix S8000 14.2 MP Digital Camera (Black)
